path: UNISA/98906 - BSc Science in Computing/COS3751 - Techniques of Artificial Intelligence/Exams/Past Papers/2011/2011 MayJune/Q&A/attachments/Pasted image 20231017071941.png
text: Consider the well-known 8-puzzle game The puzzle consists of a 3x3 board with eight tiles numbered ‘1" to ‘8’ and a single blank space Any one of the tiles horizontally or vertically adjacent to the blank space can be moved into the blank space (thereby effectively moving the blank space in the opposite direction) The object of the exercise 1s to take any given board configuration and move it into a configuration where all the numbers are in sequence The diagram illustrates possible positions for these two states of the puzzie T ———— o - R i g | = T E i I e R s | — e T T ke
